Nat,
 
Thank you for the feedback. We made a mistake in method validation somewhere
in 4.5. We'll fix it before releasing.
 
Regards,
 
Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Nat
Pryce
Sent: Tuesday, July 29, 2008 3:11 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.5 beta 3



2008/7/28 David Saff <david@... <mailto:david%40saff.net> >:
> Did anyone give it a try? Thanks,

I've ported the JMock runner to the new package structure in 4.5
Beta-3 and it works fine.

However, I noticed that the old test runner works differently in 4.5
Beta-3 than in 4.4. In 4.4 the test runner reports an error if the
test object has non-public @Before methods. In 4.5 Beta-3, it does
not. Replacing 4.4 with 4.5 Beta-3 in the jMock trunk breaks a unit
test of jMock's test runner that verifies that the test runner acts
the same as JUnit's default runner in this respect.

Is this expected behaviour? Should I change the test in jMock?

--Nat
